LADBS Roofing Permits: Re-Roof & New Roof in Los Angeles

In the City of Los Angeles, most re-roof and roof replacement projects require a building permit through LADBS. For many standard residential re-roofs, homeowners or contractors can use the Express Permit system to pull permits online for small projects such as reroofing with approved materials.

When Do You Need a Roofing Permit?

In general, you should expect to pull a permit if you are:

  • Removing and replacing roofing materials (comp shingles, tile, TPO, etc.).
  • Changing the roof structure or slope.
  • Adding new roof penetrations for solar, vents, or skylights.
  • Upgrading the roof as part of a larger addition or major remodel.

LADBS provides homeowner guides and an express online system for many small projects, but it’s still your responsibility to make sure the work is properly permitted and inspected.

Typical LADBS Roofing Permit Path

  1. Confirm whether your property is under LADBS or LA County / EPIC-LA.
  2. Gather basic info: address, roof area, materials, contractor license, etc.
  3. Apply online through LADBS (for qualifying express permits) or schedule plan review.
  4. Obtain the permit, post it on site, and follow required inspections.
  5. Pass final inspection and keep records for resale and insurance.
